title: Man Utd news: Solskjaer provides injury updates on Pogba, Matic and Tuanzebe
text:
Pogba has not played for United since September 30 (Picture: Getty)

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is optimistic that the end of Manchester United’s injury crisis is in sight despite losing Axel Tuanzebe in the warm-up against Liverpool.

Tuanzebe was initially named in the starting line-up to face Liverpool on Sunday, part of a tactical surprise from Solskjaer that involved playing three centre-backs.

But the youngster picked up a hip injury less than an hour before kick off and was replaced by Marcus Rojo for the 1-1 draw at Old Trafford.

Tuanzebe has joined United’s busy injury list (Picture: Getty)

However, his manager reckons the squad is starting to come back towards a full compliment with midfielder Paul Pogba due for a scan on his troublesome ankle at some point today.

‘I don’t know how [Tuanzebe] is,’ Solskjaer said.

‘But hopefully Jesse [Lingard] is soon back, of course Anthony [Martial] will be able to play more.

‘We’re gonna have a test on Paul tomorrow and see how he’s at and how long it’ll be before he’s back.

‘Luke [Shaw]? Not too long. So it’s looking brighter and that’s a big plus.’

Midfield remains an area of concern with youngster Scott McTominay and the much-maligned Fred forced to take on enlarged roles in the first team.

Matic has been playing through a problem at United (Picture: Getty)

Nemanja Matic has also missed time with injury and was forced to return early from international duty with Serbia.

But Solskjaer revealed that he has been trying to play through the pain for the club and now feels he can do so no more.

Solskjaer added: ‘He has played on with a little problem and he decided he couldn’t play on anymore.’
description: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is optimistic that the end of Manchester United's injury crisis is in sight despite losing Axel Tuanzebe in the warm-up against Liverpool.
